Tasks.Task Description: Use Azure Monitor to continuously track metrics such as cache hit ratio, memory usage, and latency. Investigate anomalies and optimize performance as needed.
Regularly back up Redis cache data to ensure data recovery in case of failure. Store backups securely and verify their integrity.
Check for updates to the Redis version and apply them to ensure compatibility, security, and access to new features.
Audit and update security settings, including firewall rules, access controls, and SSL configurations, to ensure the cache is protected against unauthorized access.
Evaluate cache usage and scale instances vertically or horizontally to meet performance and capacity requirements.
Conduct failover tests to ensure high availability and verify that the cache can recover from node failures without data loss.
Review and adjust cache configuration settings, such as eviction policies and maxmemory settings, to optimize performance and resource utilization.
Analyze cache usage patterns and identify opportunities for optimization, such as reducing unnecessary data storage or improving query efficiency.
Keep documentation up-to-date, including operational procedures, configuration details, and troubleshooting guides for Azure Cache for Redis.
Perform drills to prepare the team for potential cache outages or security incidents. Ensure familiarity with recovery procedures and protocols.
Evaluate the service's adherence to the SLA and address any deviations or performance issues with Azure support.
Develop and execute plans for upgrading cache capacity or migrating to higher-tier instances as needed.
Ensure the operations team participates in training to stay updated with new Azure Cache for Redis features and best practices.
Regularly validate the integrity of cached data to ensure consistency and accuracy across applications.
